intro: Czeikia scapiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered czeikia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Czeikia scapiflora is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its delicate appearance.
